column4: Question: I deleted a folder and its in my trash now, but when I try to empy my trash it says the folder is not empty so it can't be deleted, how can I permanently delete this folder in my trash?
sudo rm <file>
lol that didn't work!
I don't know where the file is.. is there a trash directory somewhere?
Your trash can is in the lower right of your screen.
I know, the folder is in the trash, how do i do sudo rm <folder> if its in the trash, where is it exactly located?
Wouldn't it be easier to restore the file from the trash and then just use that directory? I am not certain what the trash directory is.
how do i restore it?
Drag it from the trash into another folder or onto your desktop.
I tried dragging it from the trash to desktop and it gave me this error: Directory is not empty
How did you get it in there? =O Lol, one moment bud.
lol I don't know, i think i just selected it and hit delete :)
Try this
Gotta love these kinds of files... I know the command to delete it if I can find the directory...
You there?
yea, what's up?
Do this ~/.local/share/Trash (be sure of caps)
cd or rm or what command?
rm -r I think
excellent, that worked, thanks!!
Thank Bazhang too. He was the one who knew the !trash factoid.
